title: Senate Day 27 of the 2025 PM Session
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia Senate Day 27 of the 2025 PM Session session:

**Overview**
The session primarily focused on the passage of Senate Bill 4, which made several revisions to the roles and training requirements for local boards of education in Georgia. There was some debate around the scope of training content, which was addressed through an amendment.

**Key Actions**
**SB 124**: Introduced and referred to committee

**Bills Introduced (First Reading)**
- SB 124 by Senator Isakson (48th) and others - Relating to certain tax credits

**Notable Moments**
- Debate and amendment of SB 4 to clarify restrictions on training content related to pending/future legislation affecting public schools
- Discussion between senators on addressing concerns of local boards of education

**Votes**
- Amendment #1 to SB 4 proposed by Senator Dolezal (27th) - Passed
- SB 4 as amended - Passed 36-11

**Attendance**
A quorum was present for the session.

**Adjournment**
The session was adjourned. The next session will convene on the following day.
